c.t: .07 Defect 54—Windshield Wipers (Not Applicable to Motorcycles or Trailers).

c.x: Operation;
Control;
Condition of blades and arms; and
Any missing part.
The windshield wipers shall be inspected for:
The wipers are inoperative or cannot be controlled or operated by the drive
There is an arm broken or missing;
There is insufficient tension on the arm to hold the blade against windshie
The blades are excessively worn or deteriorated and do not clean the windsh
The wipers are incapable of cleaning the original arc on the windshield; or
The arms fail to return to park position.
Do not certify if:

Back-up lamp not lit when in reverse gear.

c.t: .14 Defect 68 — Rearview Mirror (Not Applicable to Trailers).

c.x: Mirrors shall be inspected for mounting and providing proper view to the re
Is loosely mounted;
Does not provide a clear view of the highway at least 200 feet to the rear;
Is cracked, broken, has sharp edges, or is clouded to the extent that rear
Is very difficult to adjust or will not maintain a set adjustment.
Do not certify if the inside mirror:
Is loose enough that rear vision is impaired;
Is obscured by the windshield pillar;
Is cracked, pitted, or clouded to the extent that rear vision is obscured.
Do not certify if the outside mirror:
Do not certify a motorcycle if it is not equipped with two rearview mirrors

Ability to hold the door tightly closed.

The latches are inoperative;
The door has broken hinges;
The doors are wired or held closed by any means not equivalent to the origi

c.x: The fuel tank cap shall be inspected for proper fit.
Fuel tank cap is not a proper fit; or
Fuel tank cap is missing.

Directional signals shall be of an approved type and inspected for function

The lamp is not functioning properly;
The lamp is not properly directed;
The lamp is not clearly visible;
The lamp has a cracked or broken lens;
The operating system is not of an approved type;
The operating system is not functioning properly;
A self-cancelling mechanism does not function properly;
A 1962 or newer model is not equipped with approved turn signals.

c.t: .18 Defect 73—Hood and Hood Catches (Not Applicable to Trailers and Motorcycles).

c.x: Coverage of engine compartment;
Attachment to the vehicle;
Height of air scoop;
Type of latch and keeper; and
Operating condition of same.
Hood and hood catches shall be inspected for:
The hood does not cover at least the top of the engine compartment;
The hood is attached by a means other than the original design or equivalen
The air scoop or bubble is higher than 1/3 the vertical height of the winds
The hood latch or keeper is not original equipment or equivalent;
The hood is not equipped with a safety latch;
The latch or keeper is not in proper operating condition;
The latch fails to hold the hood securely closed.
Do not certify if:
An acceptable hood latch or keeper is a stud and safety pin type that requi

Sharp or jagged edges;
Sufficient coverage of the wheel and tire, both from the body outward and t
